TEXT: The applicant is a GPE citizen , born in DATE . At the time when he introduced his application , he was in custody in GPE pending his extradition to the GPE .
He is represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .

On DATE the applicant was charged with conspiracy to import cocaine and attempting to import cocaine by ORG for LOC of GPE . The district attorney and the applicant signed an agreement to the effect that the applicant would plead guilty to the first charge , would be discharged on the second and would cooperate with the district attorney ’s office by acting as an undercover agent in groups of cocaine traffickers . He was then released on bail and ordered to appear before the court to be sentenced on DATE . However , he did not appear . On DATE a warrant for the applicant ’s arrest was issued by the Federal judge .

Further proceedings had also been brought against the applicant before ORG for GPE , GPE , on CARDINAL charges including armed robbery and kidnapping . On DATE the judge of this court issued a warrant for the applicant ’s arrest .

The applicant was arrested in GPE , GPE , on DATE pursuant to the international arrest warrant issued by ORG for LOC of GPE . The warrant requested the applicant ’s detention and extradition to the GPE to be tried for drug trafficking .

Following the applicant ’s arrest in GPE , ORG ( Juzgado Central de instrucción ) no . CARDINAL of the Audiencia Nacional , by a decision of DATE , ordered the applicant ’s detention pursuant to the relevant provisions of the law of CARDINAL DATE on extradition and LAW between GPE and the GPE . The court added that his detention would become invalid if a formal extradition request was not submitted within DATE from DATE of the notification to the GPE embassy , and that that period was to begin to run on DATE of the arrest .
On DATE , DATE , ORG notified the Spanish ORG of the applicant ’s detention . On DATE ORG notified ORG .

On DATE the NORP ORG received a note from the Governor of GPE , requesting that the applicant be detained and handed over to authorised agents so that he could be taken to GPE and punished according to the law .

ORG presented a Verbal Note dated DATE requesting the applicant ’s extradition . The mandatory extradition documents were received on DATE , including decisions from the GPE ORG for LOC of GPE and from ORG for GPE , GPE .
On DATE ORG of the Audiencia Nacional extended the applicant ’s detention for DATE .
On DATE ORG authorised the continuation of the extradition proceedings .

Appealing against the decision of DATE , the applicant requested the Audiencia Nacional to order his release as the mandatory extradition documents had not been received within the time laid down by law . The Audiencia Nacional , by a decision of DATE , rejected this request . The applicant lodged an appeal ( recurso de reforma ) that was also dismissed by the same court on DATE . The applicant appealed ( recurso de queja ) to the Audiencia Nacional , which rejected his appeal by a judgment of DATE . Finally , on DATE , the applicant lodged an appeal de amparo with ORG on the grounds of violation of LAW ( right to liberty ) and CARDINAL ( fair trial ) of the Spanish Constitution .

On DATE the applicant , relying on LAW on extradiction from GPE , had requested the Audiencia Nacional to obtain from the NORP authorities additional information relating to the agreement concluded between the district attorney and himself . On DATE the Audiencia Nacional had rejected this request as it considered the requested information to be irrelevant to the proceedings .

On DATE the applicant requested the Audiencia Nacional to declare the extradition request inadmissible on the grounds that the information provided by the NORP authorities was biased and said nothing of the agreement signed between the applicant and the district attorney , that the formalities had not been complied with , that there was no evidence of the applicant ’s participation in one of the offences and that there was a risk to his life on account of threats received from drug traffickers’ groups . The applicant also sought leave to submit certain evidence for the next hearing . On DATE , the Audiencia Nacional rejected this request for the same reasons as those given in its decision of DATE .

By a decision of DATE , ORG no . CARDINAL of the Audiencia Nacional found , inter alia , that the conditions regarding documentation for the purposes of mandatory extradition under LAW between GPE and GPE had been met . It indicated that both arrest warrants were good and that the Federal court had even convicted the applicant . The ORG added :

“ ... there is no doubt about the existence of the agreement ( between the applicant and the district attorney ) ... the applicant broke it since he did not appear before the court to receive sentence ... therefore only if the agreement is still valid in accordance with the laws of the requesting ORG ) .... will its content apply . ORG

The applicant ’s reasoning that he acted as an undercover agent ... and that he had to leave his country because his life was in danger , can not be considered by the court , as they are facts irrelevant to the extradition proceedings .

The applicant alleged a formal defect ... as he was detained on DATE and the extradition request was received on DATE , and therefore after the DATE period prescribed by the treaty had expired ... DATE to start counting the period was not , as alleged by the applicant , DATE of arrest , but DATE of notification of the arrest to the embassy ...
The ORG then decided :

“ To declare the extradition ( of PERSON ) admissible in order to : A ) Be sentenced for the offences of which he was found guilty by ORG ... or , if the agreement between the district attorney and the person requested is not valid , to be tried for the facts of charge no.CARDINAL and for the facts corresponding to charge no . CARDINAL ( arrest warrant of CARDINAL ) ; B ) Be tried for the facts for which proceedings were brought against him before ORG of GPE ( arrest warrant of CARDINAL.CARDINAL.CARDINAL ) . Extradition is declared admissible provided that , if the extradited person is sentenced to life imprisonment , imprisonment could not be indefinite or for the whole life ... ”

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal ( recurso de suplica ) against the Audiencia Nacional ’s decision of DATE . ORG of the Audiencia Nacional dismissed the appeal by a decision of DATE , stating , inter alia :

“ The reasons alleged by the applicant to justify his leaving the country can not be taken into account when deciding on the admissibility of the extradition request ... If the alleged risk is genuine , the applicant should seek protection from the authorities of the country concerned ...

The DATE period should start from DATE of the notification of the arrest ... to the embassy ... regardless of the fact that the ORG had been informed of the detention through ORG . Moreover , non - compliance with this DATE period could be relevant with regard to the decision of imprisonment , but not for declaring the extradition request inadmissible . ”
Replying to the applicant ’s argument about the illegality of the international arrest warrant , the ORG stated :

Although in the notification of the detention , ORG stated that the arrest warrant was dated DATE , in the communication from the NORP authorities it appears that this date corresponds to the day of the trial ... and the arrest warrant was issued on DATE . It is also reported that on DATE proceedings were brought against the applicant and on DATE the judge of the ORG for GPE issued a warrant for his arrest . ”

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal de amparo with the NORP ORG against the judgment of DATE , alleging violation of ORG CARDINAL ( right to life ) , CARDINAL ( right to liberty ) and CARDINAL ( fair trial ) of the Spanish Constitution .

On DATE the applicant applied to the Audiencia Nacional arguing that the requesting ORG ( the GPE ) should give formal , concrete and binding guarantees on the maximum duration of the sentence to be imposed on the applicant and that , if he was convicted , he should be imprisoned in a special prison for collaborators of the government . This application was rejected by ORG on DATE as it considered that the question raised had already been dealt with in its decision of DATE . On DATE the applicant lodged a second appeal ( recurso de súplica ) with the same arguments . The applicant submitted that the judgment of DATE was not sufficient as it only set generic conditions . Moreover , relying on LAW , on extradition from GPE , the applicant submitted that it was unlawful to declare extradition admissible as life imprisonment constituted inhuman and degrading treatment . The appeal was dismissed by a decision of DATE . The Criminal Chamber of the Audiencia Nacional concluded :

“ ... the decision declaring extradition admissible establishes as a condition that if the court of the requesting ORG ( the GPE ) orders life imprisonment , it should not be for whole life . As the GPE and GPE have signed an extradition treaty , signature is considered a sufficient guarantee that the GPE will comply with the commitment contained in that decision ... ”

On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal de amparo with ORG , arguing that the refusal of FAC to request the GPE authorities to give concrete and formal guarantees in the extradition proceedings constituted a violation of LAW ( right to life ) , CARDINAL ( fair trial ) and CARDINAL ( imprisonment to be oriented towards re - education and social rehabilitation ) of the Spanish Constitution .

The appeals de amparo were rejected as being manifestly ill - founded by CARDINAL decisions delivered by ORG on DATE and DATE . Concerning the applicant ’s complaint about the risks he would run if extradited , ORG stated that the hypothetical threats deriving from his former relations with criminal organisations were irrelevant since he was to be delivered to ORG who would be responsible for his safety .

On DATE the applicant asked ORG to apply Rule CARDINAL of its Rules of Procedure and ask the NORP Government to stay the execution of the extradition order . By a decision of DATE the President of the ORG rejected the request .
On DATE the applicant was extradited to GPE , where he is imprisoned in the GPE ORG .
